accepted_proposals.split_reason: Valid split: Fields distinct (In counseling psychology, 'group theory' refers to theoretical frameworks for understanding group dynamics and behavior in therapeutic or social settings, whereas in abstract algebra, 'group theory' is the mathematical study of algebraic structures called groups; these are fundamentally different core meanings that would require separate encyclopedia entries and could cause significant misunderstanding if confused.) based on parent context

Memory in psychology is defined as the persistence of learning. You can learn, recognize, and recall information. This shows your mind has an in-built storage system for information.
